title: Admissions | Master of Global Affairs | Rice University
raw_text:
HOW TO APPLY
MGA
Admissions
Ready to Apply?
Candidates are able to apply using our online system. All application documents, including statements of purpose, resumes, and letters of recommendation, can be submitted online. All applications and application documents become the confidential property of the Master of Global Affairs program and cannot be returned.
Apply Now
The
Early Decision deadline for fall 2026 applications is December 15, 2025 and the Regular Decision deadline for applications is February 15, 2026.
Applicants are solely responsible for insuring all application materials are received by the deadline and will be notified when their application is complete.
Recommended Background
B.S. or B.A. degree from an accredited four-year college or university
Excellent critical thinking skills, communication skills, and leadership skills
Application Requirements
$85 Application Fee
Statement of purpose
Professional resume
Three letters of recommendation
Official transcripts from all colleges and universities attended
GRE/GMAT scores are not required.
Approved TOEFL or IELTS scores for applicants whose native language is not English and who did not receive a degree from a country in which English is the official language of communication.
Your Questions, Answered
Applying to the Master in Global Affairs program at Rice University? Explore our
frequently asked questions
to find answers to common questions about admissions requirements, deadlines, and more. If you don’t see what you’re looking for, our admissions team is here to help. For more information, please contact Ms. Abbey Godley (
agodley@rice.edu
).
